Explanations about Options.-P(C): The interesting part is the last "grep": .   -P using perl regex -o output only matched part "\K" similar as look behind, but supports dynamic length ".*\)" match the part you need.
Explanations about Options.-P(M):
Interpret PATTERNS as Perl-compatible regular expressions (PCREs). This option is
 experimental when combined with the -z (--null-data) option, and grep -P may warn
 of unimplemented features.
Explanations about Options.-o(M):
Print only the matched (non-empty) parts of a matching line, with each such part on
 a separate output line.
Explanations about Options.-v(M): Invert the sense of matching, to select non-matching lines.

so_11325068: line='This, is a, sample input.'
for i in $(seq 1 $(echo "$line," | tr -dc ',' | wc -c)); do
  echo $line | cut -d, -f$i; 
done
